description: This lecture course provides a broad, humanistic survey to some of the most important ideas, debates and problems connected to the study of democracy. The course will be divided into three segments: the "democratic citizen" (in which we will explore ethical issues pertaining to the experience of democracy as a way of life); the "democratic People" (in which we investigate some of the best and most recent attempts to come to grips with the exceedingly difficult, yet fundamental, notion of the People); and the "democratic world" (in which we examine various issues pertaining to democratization and development, including the problems of group rights and representation, wars on behalf of democracy, and the impact of recent technological trends on the practice of democracy.
name: INTRO TO DEMOCRATIC THRY

values.comments: Students found this class both very interesting and also filled with very practical knowledge.  They praised Dr. Norris’s teaching style and felt the course would be far more valuable to the average Penn student than many mandatory introductory classes.
